keyFacts: The DOJ OIG is actively investigating the circumstances surrounding Jeffrey Epstein's death in August 2019, specifically requesting documentation on the incident, a related inmate transfer, and camera system malfunctions.

A key person of interest is a former MCC New York employee who was responsible for Correctional Services but was on leave just prior to the incident and claims no oversight of the Facilities Department or knowledge of systemic camera issues.

The investigation is seeking all documentation obtained after Epstein was found unresponsive on August 10, 2019, regarding inmate Efrain Reyes's transfer on August 9, 2019, and regarding MCC camera system issues between August 8-10, 2019.
The correspondence reveals the employee was transferred from MCC New York to FCC Forrest City, Arkansas, in September 2019, shortly after Epstein's death.
The OIG emphasizes the voluntary nature of the interview and that it is part of an official DOJ investigation, to be conducted during work hours without requiring personal leave.
